title: Trendall Crag
text: Trendall Crag () is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> crag, 1,005 m, overlooking the north side of <a href="Drygalski%20Fjord">Drygalski Fjord</a> at the southeast end of <a href="South%20Georgia%20Island">South Georgia</a>. Surveyed by the <a href="South%20Georgia%20Survey">South Georgia Survey</a> the period 1951-57 under <a href="Duncan%20Carse">Duncan Carse</a>, and named for <a href="Alec%20Trendall">Alec Trendall</a>, geologist of the SGS, 1951–52 and 1953–54.
